ABOUT.DESCRIPTION:
I'm Joanna - a Full-stack web developer focused on building robust, scalable, and thoughtfully structured web applications.

I care deeply about stability, clean architecture, and creating long-term solutions that are easy to maintain and extend. What matters most to me is making applications with good UX/UI, intuitive, fast and reliable to use.

I've worked on a wide range of projects, from smaller apps to complex systems, which has helped me develop solid engineering practices.

If you're looking for someone who thinks strategically and builds with future growth in mind - Iâ€™d love to help bring your vision to life.
ABOUT.SKILL_1: My main focus. I care about best UX/UI, responsive & animated layouts with performance in mind
ABOUT.SKILL_2: I build solid APIs, scalable logic and clean architecture to support fast, secure and maintainable apps
ABOUT.SKILL_3: Clean code, type-safety, unit tests, following style guides, naming conventions & pattern principles
ABOUT.SKILL_4: I treat bugs as challenges - the best way to learn, understand, and master a system
ABOUT.SKILL_5: Github/Gitlab team workflow using feature branches & code reviews. I believe that great code is built together
ABOUT.SKILL_6: I'm constantly learning, writing docs, improving workflows and sharing what I know with the others

PROJECTS.SUBTITLE: My recent hobby Full-Stack App
PROJECTS.DESCRIPTION:
Showflix is a single-page application (SPA) for browsing and managing a collection of over 1000 movies, built with a RESTful API and a connected database.

Users can search, filter, sort, comment on movies, and add them to their favorites with automatic genre-based statistics.

The app includes authentication and authorization - admins can manage the movie database, while users can manage their profiles.

Additional features include theme customization, with support for light/dark modes and a selectable color palette.
PROJECTS.EXTRA_INFO:
Attention: 🕒 The first request might take a few seconds - the backend wakes up from a serverless cold start (hosted on Railway).
